title: Recycling FAQ
summary: This article provides a basic overview of what types of plastic packaging are accepted for recycling, and what is not. - Accepted plastics include bottles, jugs, jars and tubs. - Unacceptable plastics include plastic bags, films, and overwrap. - Size, shape, and the type of plastic all play a role in recyclability.

title: Trackers Placed in Amazon Packaging Reveal What Really Happens to Store Drop-Off Recycling
summary: An investigation by U.S. PIRG and Environment America found that very little of Amazon's plastic packaging is recycled through store drop-off programs, despite the company's claims. The How2Recycle label, which indicates that a product can be recycled through store drop-off, has been criticized for misleading consumers. Some companies, such as Mondelez, have pledged to stop using the label.
likely_naics_codes: ['322210 - Pulp, Paper, and Paperboard Mills', '322220 - Paperboard Container Manufacturing', '322230 - Paperboard Box Manufacturing', '326199 - Other Plastics Product Manufacturing']
greenwashing: Amazon's use of the How2Recycle label on its plastic packaging could be considered greenwashing, as the label suggests that the packaging can be recycled through store drop-off programs when in reality very little of it is.

title: Inside the Industry Push to Label Your Yogurt Cup ‘Recyclable’
summary: The article discusses the issue of deceptive recycling labels on plastic products. It focuses on the organization How2Recycle, which sells labels to companies that claim to indicate a product's recyclability, but which environmental advocates argue are misleading. The article also discusses the broader issue of greenwashing in the plastics industry, where companies make false or exaggerated claims about the environmental benefits of their products.

title: Can Semiconductor Chips be Recycled?
summary: Semiconductor chips are essential components of modern electronic devices, but their production and disposal pose environmental risks. Recycling is crucial for mitigating these risks, but semiconductor recycling has unique challenges due to the complex composition of chips. Innovative recycling techniques and advancements in electronics design prioritize recyclability, offering promising avenues for sustainable practices within the semiconductor industry.
